newsitem.title: UK: Growth funds push UK unit trust sales to 1 bln stg.
newsitem.headline: Growth funds push UK unit trust sales to 1 bln stg.

text.p: A surge of interest by UK retail and institutional investors in growth funds pushed the total sales of unit trusts in November 1996 to just under one billion stg, latest data from the UK trade body shows.
A statement from the Association of Unit Trusts and Investment Funds (AUTIF) said total net investment for November was 946 million stg.

Institutional unit trust sales in November of 537 million stg were at one of the highest levels for 1996. AUTIF said institutions favoured international sectors like Europe and International Growth funds.

Net retail sales were at 409 million stg, up from 310 million stg the month before and 313 million stg in November 1995. Net PEP (personal equity plan) sales were at 309 million stg, up from 283 million in October 1996 and 273 million stg a year before.
AUTIF said unit trust funds under management topped 130 billion stg and unit trust PEP funds now totalled 25 billion stg. There are just under eight million unitholder accounts in the UK.
